comment: If you aren't good at math, avoid him! The class is mostly learning from Aleks, as he barely teaches more than 1 example per problem type. You do can bring a note card for tests, and definitely should. Lots of homework, essentially the only way to learn. Also calls on students during class. Attendence is part of your grade
How are you going to have the answer key and still teach the problem wrong??

If ur not good at math, avoid him. He makes a lot of mistakes, not respectful towards students, and attendance matters. There is A LOT of homework. Only good thing is that he allows a small sized flashcard to be used on tests days (in person) and I wrote down all study guide questions and solved them step by step in order to know what to do.

If you are not good at mat, this is not the professor for you. He has a big attitud with students, as well as attendance is required and part of your grade. He calls on people in front of the class to answer questions. If you want a good grade, do not take him.

As someone who is not good at math, this class was a nightmare. it is graded by few things and the professor fails to actually teach the content. I wanted an in person class to learn in person but everything you do will be online, at home, by yourself. avoid this class if you are bad at math!!
rating_tags: Lecture heavy--Test heavy--Graded by few things

comment: please do not take this class if you are bad at math like myself. He does not actually teach you anything, and you will need to rely off of Aleks the entire course. Save yourself the time and just enroll in an online course, because it will be the exact same or maybe even better because no useless attendance grade.

He is not good at his job. When calling on people he constantly interrupts them and talks over them. He constantly gets problems wrong on the board. Everything is on Aleks which isn't too difficult, tests are mainly on paper. You basically teach yourself the whole time. I just sat in class and did my homework. If you're good at math you'll be okay.
a lot of learning has to be done outside of the classroom because he teaches as if you already know the material. would not recommend it if you struggle in math.

He's a very kind professor. He lets us have a 3x5 notecard for each test and even on our final. Just make sure you do your ALEKS homework on time and score well on the tests. He's older and kind of monotone but I like the way he teaches. Just PLEASE make sure you do your homework, go to every class, and score WELL on the tests and you'll pass!! :))

DO NOT TAKE HIM!!!!!
He is extremely misogynistic and disrespectful towards people of color, giving certain people unfair advantages. He is critical about grading, even going out of his way to tell me how to correctly write my numbers. Attendance is mandatory yet he doesn't teach, making it very hard for students to come to class.
Do the aleks homework and do the study guides easy A. Very boring but is ok

How this guy still has a job is absolutely mind-blowing. Does problems wrong directly from his "binder". I'm just saying how are you going to have the answer key and STILL teach the problem wrong. The university could do so much better.
rating_tags: Lecture heavy--Test heavy--Graded by few things

comment: This professor is really nice but is very monotone. Lectures can be long and slow. Basically a review of high school algebra with a few extra concepts.

Professor Eakes is an ok professor. His teaching style is just talking and writing, he doesn't actually teach for real. He's overall a nice guy, but you're going to have to pay attention if you wanna pass

absolutely WOULD NOT recommend this professor especially if you are bad at math. during his lectures he does not actually teach the material he glances over it and will do multiple different topics in one class which will leave students left behind. he very often messes up while teaching which can leave student even more confused.not helpful at all

Eakes' class was a disappointing experience. His lectures lacked structure, making them difficult to follow. He would jump from one topic to another without clear explanations, leaving students behind.  he appeared disinterested in teaching, often wasting class time with incorrect answers. Attendance was mandatory but felt like a waste of time.

Professor Eakes is a very nice gentlemen, however he presents the math material in a very confusing way. He isn't very clear with explanations on problems. However his study guides really, really help with the tests so you can teach yourself at the end of unit. Very nice guy, I just wouldn't take him again.

The class is fairly easy. He uploads notes over the unit. I could easily learn from the notes because they give explanations and steps for the problems. The only homework are alecks assignments which are easy. You can use a cheat notecard on the test. Test also do not have a lot of questions. The only thing I struggle is the test which average a B.

He's not an awful teacher! If you keep up with ALEKS assignments and finish them on time you will pass. He's not great at explaining, often makes mistakes and glances over topics. No application/practice other than the HW. He can be rude when answering questions and it can make you feel dumb. He pretty much relies on ALEKS for everything.

He does not teach you how to do the problems, he just reads over the "binder" he posts on D2L and does not go into any depth on why you do a specific problem that way. He allows a notecard on the test, but don't worry that doesn't matter because you will fail all of them anyway. He is a sweet guy, but not a great teacher. Unfortunately don't rec.
rating_tags: Tough grader--Lecture heavy--Graded by few things

comment: terrible teacher, absolutely wouldn't recommend. just lectures for 2 hours then piles you with lots of homework. He also promised to give extra credit for bad assignments, never replied back to my email.

To start, he was a good professor. He is always willing to answer questions and provide help. However, his class consists solely of going over content in ALEKS (course website). There is no participation or interaction in any of the lessons and there are many weekly assignments, but there are make-up hw opportunities. Definitely a tough class.
rating_tags: Lots of homework--Skip class? You won't pass.--Lecture heavy

comment: He's a friendly professor. This course requires you to show up, take notes, and do the weekly homework. It isn't too hard. Personally having struggles with math, I found this class to be pretty brutal, but if you have good time management skills and a good understanding of math you'll be good. Very easy overall. Only 4 tests, hw, and a final.
rating_tags: Gives good feedback--Skip class? You won't pass.--Graded by few things

comment: If you are not good at math, I would not recommend this class. When he teaches, he can go fast and glance over topics. He is not flexible about due dates and calls you out if you leave early or show up late even if you have a good reason. He does his job and teaches the content, but you're on your own if you don't understand the content.
rating_tags: Skip class? You won't pass.--Clear grading criteria--Lecture heavy

comment: He was an awesome professor! His class was a lecture for an hour and 15 minutes twice a week & he would review the homework. The homework was always due at the end of the week and was used on a platform called ALEKS. there were 3 tests & a final and they were all very easy. if you struggle with math please take this class!
rating_tags: Graded by few things--Caring--Clear grading criteria

comment: Due to covid, his class was taught online. we used this program called aleks and assignments were given weekly and were an easy A. even though participation is a grade, i never attented class and still managed to get an A. but thats only because i got A's on all of my tests. if youre not a math person, please attend class.

I would warn students that this professor does not do well when explaining mathematical concepts. He often forgets what he was doing during lecture and students have had to correct him several times before the right/correct answer was given. He also does not show you how to solve ANY of the problems w/ TI -84. I would like to say more but I can't.
rating_tags: Lots of homework--Get ready to read--Test heavy

comment: So I really just took this class to boost my GPA but since everything is on ALEKS it's fairly simple. He explains a lot of things but does move quickly so definitely take note while doing the homework. I usually go to class but typically work on the homework during it. He takes attendance and will call on people randomly so pay a little attention.
everything was based on Aleks. I stopped paying attention in class and just did the weekly aleks work instead and still got an A. he takes attendance daily but if you dont show up youll be fine.

He means well, but lectures really fast. You miss a class, you miss a lot. Either you'll grasp it or you won't. Clear cut grader. Complete you homework via Aleks in the time allotted. I never purchased the scientific calculator and managed just fine.

Everything was done on Aleks, even though it wasn't an online course. He is a really great professor and the people who wrote bad reviews probably never went to class. Trust me you will not regret taking him. Attendance is taken but you are not graded on it.

Very difficult professor. If you struggle with math, do not take Professor Eakes. He's not very helpful when it comes to needing help. Very mundane in his teaching methods and not understanding of personal issues. His lectures are extremely drawn out and boring and makes mistakes often. No sense of a positive personal connection with students.
rating_tags: Participation matters--Skip class? You won't pass.--Lecture heavy

comment: Professor Eakes is a fine teacher for those who are willing to put in large amounts of time and effort outside of class. I would not recommend him for students who have trouble in Math as he does not have office hours and isn't the best at lectures. He is a stereotypical college professor and does not give extra credit nor second chances.
rating_tags: Skip class? You won't pass.--Test heavy--Lecture heavy

comment: Mr Eakes really cares if you do well. He drops the lowest quiz grade and replaces your lowest test with your grade on the final. Mymathlab can be confusing and he dosent really understand it. He teaches some good tricks that arent in the book or the Mymathlab videos. He's funny, sometimes intentionally, sometimes not

I am horrible at math, but if you actually attend his classes he breaks down the material pretty thoroughly. You can always ask him if you are confused on a concept and he will go over the material with you one on one after class. He truly wants to see his students succeed and he understands that most people are in his class because it is required

He's awesome. Hw is simple and to the point. Has the rare ability to break difficult topics down into a freshman level course. Would absolutely take again. Doing the homework and practice tests should get you an A. Don't forget about the quizzes.

Homework allowed unlimited attempts to get 100%. Quizzes allowed 3 or more attempts. So that right there is a bunch of your grade that can easily be 100%. Go to class. His lectures really helped me understand stuff that made no sense in the book, plus he takes attendance and can do pop quizzes. Gives practice tests.
rating_tags: Skip class? You won't pass.--Clear grading criteria--Caring

comment: Boring lectures - can be hard to pay attention. Expects you to go to class, but doesn't grade attendance. Every once in awhile he will randomly call on people to answer questions. HW every unit, but you get unlimited chances to do it. Quiz every chapter, but you get 4 chances per quiz. Tests aren't bad, just study the prac test he posts.

Knows his stuff but not great at explaining. Gives short hand notes that only he can understand. Doesn't grade attendance & for this reason if you are sick & miss something he will not let you makeup (even with Doc. note). Will tell you to do well on next assignment. 3 open ended tests. Final multiple choice. Decent teacher but I would NOT retake.

He was a good math teacher. I didn't like how his tests were online but other than that I found the class bearable. He gives you 4 tests including the final and then drops the lowest test grade. He also drops your lowest quiz grade. There is a good bit of homework but its not too bad. He was nice in class and made math not so bad!

Pretty good teacher, he really knows his stuff. Homework is all online, and pretty straight forward. 5 quizzes and 4 tests. He drops your lowest quiz score and replaces your lowest test score with what you make on the final if it is higher. (The final is the easiest exam of the semester and boosted my final grade up 10 points).

Mr. Eakes is a great professor. He is very willing to help when needed. He explains the material really well and is lenient in his grading. Even lets students take part of their exam online after class. He wants everyone to do well. I highly recommend him.

Probably the best math teacher I've ever had he explains things very clearly and takes time to answer everyone's questions. Drops lowest quiz score and replaces lowest test score with final. Homework isn't counted off if answers are incorrect you just have to rework the question.
Great teacher. Not too much homework. 5 tests plus a final. 5 quizzes.
He is a boring guy but if you're decent at math he teaches well, and homework is easy and helps your grade so much! Just go to class and take notes you should pass fine.

He was not clear at all. The only easy thing in this course was the homework which was all online. His tests would not have been difficult, but he does not give ANY partial credit. How do you teach MATH and not give partial credit... ridiculous. STAY AWAY.

I took a 3 hour Saturday math course with Professor Eakes, and although sometimes I wanted to pull my hair out, his class is survivable and easy. He always goes over homework, makes sure people understand what's gong on, and he is fast at grading tests as well. It is an easy class if you do study and pay attention to due dates on My Math Lab.
Easy class. Basic math. Three tests and a final and he replaces your lowest test grade with the final. Basic math lecture. Kind of boring.

Very boring class.. so boring it's hard to pay attention. Teaches very fast and makes mistakes often while teaching, therefore it becomes confusing. Gives homework every class. Test are not to hard if you understand the material. I would not recommend taking him. However, very nice guy. I do like him as a person just not a professor

Really great math teacher. Explains everything clearly and in-detail. Answers all your questions and his reviews are essentially what's going to be on the tests (with some changes). Show up for review day.

Probably one of the easiest math classes I've ever taken. If you need college algebra, take him. He literally gives you a study guide that's exactly like the test with the numbers changed. As long as you know how to work those problems, you're golden. Homework is mymathlab, easy. Don't buy the book, it comes with mymathlab. Good luck.

He is a halfway decent teacher. But makes alot of mistakes. The book is not needed and he tells you that on day one because it can be accessed through mymathlab. homework is easy just don't loose track of the due dates. he is a tough grader on tests and you absolutely have to work everything out or you will not get great grades on his tests.

Great guy, can be somewhat confusing at times. Participation matters to him. His grading on tests can be tough, he wants exact answers and worked out exactly the way he wants it to be. Lectures run short, yay. Homework is easy. Book hardly used at all. He provides help if you need it.  Average professor, any student can pass if they pay attention.

Professor Eakes was great. Took Saturday 8am class. He went over textbook chapters and helped practice with mymathlab hw. Quizzes on mymathlab and tests (3+final, lowest dropped) were just like his practice exams. I suck at math but he was a great instructor. explained things when needed and taught me shortcuts. easy A for college algebra.

Mr. Eakes actually made math pretty understandable, and if you have any questions, ask him IN CLASS and he'll gladly help. If you email him a couple days before the homework is due saying math lab is down, he basically tells you "SOL" I honestly would recommend him though. He shows you the summer tests and answers, which helps you before YOUR exam

Professor Eakes was very helpful. He explains the coursework so that anyone will understand. He expects you to be in class and takes roll. He gives practice test and the actual test are similar. All quizzes were online . He does give quite a bit  of homework but if you do it all it will help you master the tests.  I would definitely recommend him.
